# Audience Context Cache

**Purpose:** Customer personas, pain points, and audience research data
**Token Budget:** ~2-3k tokens
**Cache Duration:** Long-term (updates quarterly)

---

## Primary Personas

### Strategic Sarah (VP Marketing)
**Demographics:**
- Age: 35-50
- Title: VP Marketing, CMO, Head of Marketing
- Company Size: 100-1000 employees
- Industry: B2B SaaS, Technology
- Location: Major metro areas (SF, NYC, Austin, Boston)

**Goals:**
- Prove marketing ROI to executive team
- Scale demand generation efficiently
- Build predictable pipeline for sales
- Implement data-driven marketing
- Stay ahead of marketing trends

**Pain Points:**
- Difficulty attributing revenue to marketing efforts
- Limited budget, pressure to do more with less
- Siloed data across multiple marketing tools
- Lack of marketing automation sophistication
- Challenges aligning marketing and sales teams

**Buying Behavior:**
- Research-intensive (3-6 months consideration)
- Values case studies and peer recommendations
- Requires executive buy-in and ROI justification
- Prefers structured demos and proof of concepts
- Expects consultative sales approach

**Channels:**
- LinkedIn (primary professional network)
- Industry events and conferences
- Marketing podcasts and webinars
- Marketing blogs (HubSpot, Gartner, etc.)
- Peer networks and Slack communities

**Content Preferences:**
- Strategic frameworks and playbooks
- ROI calculators and benchmarking data
- Executive-level case studies
- Industry trend reports
- Best practice guides

**Messaging That Resonates:**
- "Prove marketing impact with attribution modeling"
- "Scale pipeline generation 3x with same budget"
- "Align marketing and sales with shared metrics"
- "Data-driven decision making for modern CMOs"

---

### Technical Tom (Marketing Operations Manager)
**Demographics:**
- Age: 28-40
- Title: Marketing Ops Manager, Marketing Analyst, Growth Analyst
- Company Size: 50-500 employees
- Industry: SaaS, E-commerce, Technology
- Location: Distributed/remote-friendly companies

**Goals:**
- Implement and optimize marketing technology stack
- Build automated workflows and campaigns
- Create reliable data pipelines and dashboards
- Improve lead quality and scoring
- Reduce manual work through automation

**Pain Points:**
- Complex integrations between marketing tools
- Data inconsistencies across platforms
- Time spent on manual reporting and data cleaning
- Lack of technical resources for customization
- Difficulty proving value of marketing ops function

**Buying Behavior:**
- Technical evaluation focused (2-4 weeks POC)
- Values documentation and API capabilities
- Needs hands-on testing before commitment
- Influenced by developer/technical communities
- Prefers self-service onboarding

**Channels:**
- LinkedIn, Twitter (tech marketing community)
- Technical documentation and API references
- Marketing ops communities (MO Pros, RevOps Co-Op)
- YouTube tutorials and walkthroughs
- Product Hunt, G2, Capterra reviews

**Content Preferences:**
- Technical guides and implementation docs
- Workflow automation templates
- Integration tutorials and best practices
- Data modeling and attribution guides
- Tool comparison matrices

**Messaging That Resonates:**
- "Automate your entire lead lifecycle in hours"
- "Native integrations with 100+ marketing tools"
- "Build custom attribution models without code"
- "API-first platform for ultimate flexibility"

---

### Content Creator Chris (Content Marketing Manager)
**Demographics:**
- Age: 25-38
- Title: Content Manager, Content Strategist, Social Media Manager
- Company Size: 20-500 employees
- Industry: Wide range (B2B and B2C)
- Location: Creative hubs (LA, NYC, Austin, Portland)

**Goals:**
- Create high-performing content that drives results
- Build efficient content production workflows
- Measure content impact on pipeline and revenue
- Scale content creation without sacrificing quality
- Stay on top of content trends and formats

**Pain Points:**
- Difficulty proving content ROI
- Limited time and resources for content production
- Challenges maintaining consistent publishing schedule
- SEO complexity and algorithm changes
- Content ideation and writer's block

**Buying Behavior:**
- Values ease of use and creative freedom
- Quick decision cycle (1-2 months)
- Influenced by free trials and templates
- Needs visual proof (screenshots, examples)
- Price-sensitive, looks for value

**Channels:**
- Instagram, TikTok (content inspiration)
- Content marketing blogs and newsletters
- YouTube (tutorials and tips)
- Twitter (content marketing community)
- Content marketing events and webinars

**Content Preferences:**
- Content templates and swipe files
- SEO and keyword research guides
- Content performance benchmarks
- Creative inspiration and trend reports
- Time-saving tips and hacks

**Messaging That Resonates:**
- "Create a month of content in one day"
- "SEO-optimized content that actually ranks"
- "Proven templates from top content marketers"
- "Measure content ROI with attribution"

---

## Customer Journey Stages

### Awareness Stage
**Mindset:** "I have a problem but don't know solutions exist"

**Content Needs:**
- Educational blog posts and guides
- Industry trend reports
- Problem-focused content (not solution-focused)
- Thought leadership articles
- Social media content

**Marketing Tactics:**
- SEO-optimized content
- Social media organic and paid
- PR and media outreach
- Influencer partnerships
- Display advertising (brand awareness)

**Success Metrics:**
- Impressions and reach
- Website traffic
- Brand awareness lift
- Social engagement

---

### Consideration Stage
**Mindset:** "I understand my problem and am researching solutions"

**Content Needs:**
- Comparison guides and reviews
- Product category overviews
- Expert webinars and workshops
- Case studies and success stories
- Detailed how-to guides

**Marketing Tactics:**
- Retargeting campaigns
- Email nurture sequences
- Webinar campaigns
- Content upgrades and lead magnets
- Review site optimization (G2, Capterra)

**Success Metrics:**
- Engaged visitors (2+ pages, 2+ min)
- Email sign-ups and MQLs
- Content download rate
- Webinar attendance

---

### Decision Stage
**Mindset:** "I'm evaluating specific vendors and ready to buy"

**Content Needs:**
- Product demos and free trials
- Detailed pricing information
- Customer testimonials and reviews
- ROI calculators and business cases
- Implementation guides and support info

**Marketing Tactics:**
- Sales-enabled content
- Product-focused ads
- Competitive battle cards
- Live demos and consultations
- Retargeting with offers

**Success Metrics:**
- Demo requests and trial sign-ups
- SQLs and opportunities created
- Conversion rate
- Time to close

---

### Retention Stage
**Mindset:** "I'm a customer and need to succeed with the product"

**Content Needs:**
- Onboarding resources and tutorials
- Best practice guides
- Feature updates and releases
- Success stories from similar customers
- Community and support content

**Marketing Tactics:**
- Onboarding email sequences
- In-app messaging and tooltips
- Customer success check-ins
- User community building
- Educational webinars for customers

**Success Metrics:**
- Activation rate
- Feature adoption
- Product usage metrics
- Customer satisfaction (CSAT, NPS)

---

### Advocacy Stage
**Mindset:** "I love this product and want to share it"

**Content Needs:**
- Referral program information
- Co-marketing opportunities
- User-generated content campaigns
- Review request templates
- Ambassador program details

**Marketing Tactics:**
- Referral programs with incentives
- Case study creation process
- Review generation campaigns
- Community advocate recognition
- Partner and integration programs

**Success Metrics:**
- Net promoter score (NPS)
- Referral traffic and conversions
- Reviews and ratings
- User-generated content volume

---

## Buyer Psychology

### Cognitive Biases to Leverage

**Social Proof:**
- "Join 10,000+ marketers using [product]"
- Customer logos and testimonials
- Review scores and star ratings
- User counts and popularity metrics

**Scarcity:**
- Limited-time offers
- Limited availability messaging
- Countdown timers
- Exclusive early access

**Authority:**
- Expert endorsements
- Industry certifications
- Awards and recognition
- Media mentions and press

**Reciprocity:**
- Free tools and calculators
- Educational content and guides
- Free trials and samples
- Exclusive community access

**Consistency:**
- Small commitment first (email sign-up)
- Progressive engagement (quiz → guide → webinar)
- Micro-conversions leading to macro
- Aligned with self-perception

---

## Segmentation Strategies

### Behavioral Segmentation
- **Engagement level:** Active, inactive, at-risk
- **Product usage:** Power users, casual users, non-users
- **Purchase history:** Frequency, recency, monetary value
- **Content consumption:** Topics, formats, frequency

### Firmographic Segmentation (B2B)
- **Company size:** SMB (<200), Mid-market (200-1000), Enterprise (1000+)
- **Industry:** SaaS, E-commerce, Professional Services, etc.
- **Revenue:** <$10M, $10-100M, $100M+
- **Technology stack:** Identified through integrations

### Demographic Segmentation (B2C)
- **Age:** Gen Z (18-24), Millennials (25-40), Gen X (41-56), Boomers (57+)
- **Income:** Budget-conscious, mid-tier, premium
- **Location:** Urban, suburban, rural
- **Life stage:** Students, young professionals, families, retirees

### Psychographic Segmentation
- **Values:** Innovation, efficiency, community, sustainability
- **Interests:** Professional development, creativity, data-driven
- **Personality:** Risk-taker vs. cautious, early adopter vs. late majority
- **Lifestyle:** Fast-paced, balanced, leisurely

---

## Pain Point Mapping

### By Department

**Marketing Team:**
- Proving ROI and marketing attribution
- Limited budget and resources
- Keeping up with tool/platform changes
- Creating enough quality content
- Aligning with sales on lead quality

**Sales Team:**
- Not enough qualified leads
- Long sales cycles
- Difficulty standing out from competition
- Complex product demonstrations
- Lost deals to cheaper competitors

**Product Team:**
- Understanding customer needs and feedback
- Prioritizing feature requests
- Communicating product value
- Balancing innovation with stability
- Competing with established players

**Executive Team:**
- Predictable revenue growth
- Market differentiation
- Customer acquisition costs
- Competitive positioning
- Scaling efficiently

---

## Messaging Frameworks

### Jobs-to-be-Done (JTBD)
**Framework:** "When [situation], I want to [motivation], so I can [outcome]"

**Examples:**
- "When planning a campaign, I want to predict ROI, so I can get budget approval"
- "When analyzing performance, I want to see attribution, so I can optimize spend"
- "When creating content, I want templates, so I can work faster"

### Before-After-Bridge (BAB)
**Before:** Current pain state
**After:** Desired future state
**Bridge:** How product gets you there

**Example:**
- **Before:** "Spending hours manually reporting on campaign performance"
- **After:** "Automated dashboards that update in real-time"
- **Bridge:** "Our platform connects all your data sources and creates custom dashboards in minutes"

### Problem-Agitate-Solve (PAS)
**Problem:** Identify the core issue
**Agitate:** Amplify the pain
**Solve:** Present the solution

**Example:**
- **Problem:** "Attribution is broken in most marketing analytics tools"
- **Agitate:** "You're making budget decisions based on last-click only, missing 70% of the customer journey"
- **Solve:** "Our multi-touch attribution shows the complete path to purchase"

---

## Channel-Specific Audience Insights

### LinkedIn Audience
- Professional context (career advancement)
- Research and learning mode
- Values thought leadership
- Responds to data and insights
- Best times: Tuesday-Thursday, 8-10am, 12-1pm

### Facebook/Instagram Audience
- Personal and entertaining context
- Visual-first content consumption
- Values authenticity and relatability
- Responds to emotion and storytelling
- Best times: Varies by demographic

### Twitter Audience
- Real-time news and trends
- Quick consumption, high scroll speed
- Values wit and conciseness
- Responds to controversy and hot takes
- Best times: Weekdays during commute hours

### Email Audience
- Permission-based relationship
- Higher intent and engagement
- Values personalization and relevance
- Responds to clear value propositions
- Best times: Tuesday-Thursday, 10am-2pm
